numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I have seen that wealthier students are more likely to get into college.
2. I have noticed that legacy students have a better chance of acceptance.
3. This trend is not morally right.
4. This trend is common in the graph.
5. I am curious about a legacy student who is not wealthy.
6. I ask whether a legacy student who is not wealthy can still get accepted.
7. I ask whether not being wealthy reduces the chance of acceptance for a legacy student.
8. I ask whether universities accept more wealthy students.
9. I ask whether universities do this because wealthy students can repay tuition faster than students who take out loans.
10. I ask whether a student with superior grades can overcome a family legacy.
11. I ask whether a student with a more remarkable resume can overcome a family legacy.
12. This situation affects me and my community.
14. These students will be the first in their families to attend college.
16. I ask how these students will achieve their goal if universities prefer legacy students.
17. My community will have a harder time if acceptance rates continue to rise at the same rate as the expected increase of legacy students.
18. I ask whether you got accepted into college.
19. I ask whether you are a legacy student.
